title: Christian Pulisic ecstatic after scoring hat-trick as Redknapp hails 'breakthrough' display
text:
Christian Pulisic thanked his team-mates for helping him to adapt to life in the Premier League after scoring a hat-trick in Chelsea's 4-2 win over Burnley.

Pulisic has endured a difficult start to life at Stamford Bridge after losing his place in the starting XI before being reinstated by Frank Lampard at Turf Moor.

The forward scored a perfect hat-trick on the back of an impressive substitute appearance in Wednesday's Champions League win over Ajax and revealed his delight after the game.

Christian Pulisic scored a perfect hat-trick as Chelsea beat Burnley 4-2 at Turf Moor

Pulisic has had to be patient for starts after his £52 million move to Chelsea this summer

The forward thanked his team-mates for helping to adapt to English football after the game

'The first few months were definitely hard,' he said to Sky Sports. 'I had a few starts but then I’ve had to be patient.

The last few weeks I’ve shown what I can do. I’ve then got a start and made the most of it, it's been a really special day for me.

'It takes time coming to a big new club and I’m happy with my progress so far, I didn’t expect things to happen overnight. My team-mates have been brilliant with me so far.'

Pulisic was hailed by Jamie Redknapp, who described his display as his 'breakthrough' moment

Sky Sports pundit Jamie Redknapp was also quick to praise Pulisic's resilience and felt his performance was his 'breakthrough' moment in English football.

'It’s been difficult for Pulisic, he’s had to wait while the likes of Mount and Abraham have impressed. What a night for the young man, he’s been patient and shown his ability.

'At £57m there is an expectation for him to make an impact straight away. Today feels like a breakthrough moment for him. It’s a new league and he’s a young man, he seems very grounded and I’m very happy for him.'
description: Christian Pulisic thanked his team-mates for helping him to adapt to life in the Premier League after scoring a hat-trick in Chelsea's 4-2 win over Burnley at Turf Moor on Saturday evening.
